author: Si_UKNZ
title: a great improvement on the aa box, but why the huge price jump?
review:
Loving the fact that this is the same size as the rechargeable box, and has no superfluous bits sticking out of it like the 8881 AA box, and since it uses AAA is lighter and smaller.

Superior in every way except the price - why oh why is it exactly twice the price of the AA box - come on Lego, some of this pricing is getting ridiculous, there's no need for this to cost so much!

author: Legolijntje
title: A very good replacement for the 8878
review:
I bought this set because many Technic MOC instructions use the 8878 and I wanted to buil them, but I didn't wanted to spend â‚¬50 on an battery box, so I bought this one.

Pros

  • It is lighter than a normal AA battery box
  • It's easier to use in model-team/creator/city MOCs
  • I'ts a bit smaller than the normal AA battery box.
  • The buttons to turn on and off and to switch direction are much easier to use than the normal AA battery box.

Cons

  • It hasn't a speed switch like on the 8878
  • You have to use a very small screwdriver to open the battery box and change the batteries

 

So, this is a very good value for your money. You can use it easier in most MOCs and it's a good replacement for the 8878.

 

If you don't know if you want to buy this one or the 8878, here's a tip:

If you know you're going to use it very much, it's maybe better to buy the 8878. Before you know it, you spend more on the batteries than you did for a 8878...
